card_game_24.objects

Class DeckOfCards

  • java.lang.Object
    • card_game_24.objects.DeckOfCards

  • public class DeckOfCards
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Deck of Cards. Hearts (1-13), Diamonds (14-26), Clubs (27-39), then Spades(40-52). Card images found at: http://opengameart.org/content/playing-cards-vector-png Project: 24 Card Game Platform: jdk 1.8.0_14; NetBeans IDE 8.1; Windows 10 Course: CS 143 Created on May 23, 2016, 4:02 PM Revised on Jun 1, 2016, 11:15 PM

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javax.swing.ImageIcon> cards
      ImageIcons of all the cards in the deck.
      private int[] hand
      The current hand being played, integer numbers 1-52 representing which card is in play.
      private static int IMAGE_HEIGHT
      The width at which we wish our images to be displayed at.
      private static int IMAGE_WIDTH
      The height at which we wish our images to be displayed at.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeckOfCards()
      Default constructor, creates the deck of cards and draws a hand to play.

        private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javax.swing.ImageIcon> cards

    • Method Detail

      • resetHand

        public void resetHand()
        Resets the hand which the player can choose cards from.

      • drawHand

        private int[] drawHand()
        Draws four unique cards from the deck, and returns their indices to the caller.
        Returns:
        An int array of the cards indices which were drawn.

      • getHand

        public int[] getHand()
        Returns:
        The current hand of the Game.

      • getDeck

        public java.util.HashMap getDeck()
        Returns:
        The deck of cards, as ImageIcons, Hearts (1-13), Diamonds (14-26), Clubs (27-39), then Spades(40-52).

      • isNumberInHand

        private boolean isNumberInHand(int number,
                               int[] arr)
        Determines whether a number is already in an array.
        Parameters:
        number - The number we are searching for.
        arr - The array we are searching through.
        Returns:
        true if the number is found.

      • createCards

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javax.swing.ImageIcon> createCards()
        Generates a HashMap with 1-52 as keys and ImageIcons of the corresponding cards as values. Key % 13 should give the corresponding card value, though 13 will map to zero.
        Returns:
        A HashMap with playing card ImageIcons.

      • rescaleDeckImages

        private void rescaleDeckImages(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,javax.swing.ImageIcon> deck)
        Resizes every ImageIcon value inside a HashMap with Strings as keys.
        Parameters:
        deck - The deck of cards we are resizing the images of, it's a HashMap with Strings for keys and ImageIcons (which we are resizing) as values.

      • getScaledImage

        private java.awt.Image getScaledImage(java.awt.Image srcImg,
                                      int width,
                                      int height)
        Scales a single Image to the correct size for our application.
        Parameters:
        srcImg - The image we wish to rescale.
        width - The width we wish our image to be.
        height - The height we wish our image to be.
        Returns:
        The rescaled Image.
